tool.name: RECETOX apLCMS - adjust time

configfiles.configfile:
#set filenames_str = str("', '").join([str($f.element_identifier) for $f in $files]) files_list <- c('$filenames_str')
extracted_features <- lapply(files_list, arrow::read_parquet) extracted_features <- lapply(extracted_features, as.matrix)
corrected <- adjust.time( features = extracted_features, #if $peak_alignment.align_mz_tol: mz.tol = $peak_alignment.align_mz_tol, #end if #if $peak_alignment.align_chr_tol: chr.tol = $peak_alignment.align_chr_tol, #end if find.tol.max.d = 10 * $mz_tol, max.align.mz.diff = $peak_alignment.max_align_mz_diff, do.plot = FALSE )
df <- as.data.frame(corrected) arrow::write_parquet(df, "$corrected_feature_sample_table")

param.name: files
param.label: Input data
param.help: Mass spectrometry files containing feature samples.

param.name: mz_tol
param.label: mz_tol
param.help: The m/z tolerance level for the grouping of data points. This value is expressed as the fraction of the m/z value. This value, multiplied by the m/z value, becomes the cutoff level. The recommended value is the machine's nominal accuracy level. Divide the ppm value by 1e6. For FTMS, 1e-5 is recommended.

tool.help:
This is a tool which runs apLCMS adjusting of time.
@GENERAL_HELP@
